intro: Crucianella macrostachya var. brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its floating leaves and specialized structures called bladders, which are used for capturing small aquatic organisms. The plant is native to freshwater habitats in Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in still or slow-moving waters, often in muddy or sandy substrates. Its flowers are small and yellowish, appearing in clusters at the water surface.
